result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel Angel Aca Gutierrez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
First half in custody, Second half may be served on electronic home monitoring if qualifies for program.
May be transferred to Sauk County.
Sheriff's Department may allow Defendant to serve the entire jail sentence on home monitor if approved and if financially better.
Concurrent with: with 15CT323

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Miguel Angel Aca Gutierrez
Current: 177 Forest Drive, #907, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965 United States  (Effective: 06-14-2016)
Prior: 2031 2nd St N, Wis Rapids, WI 54494

Defendant Miguel Angel Aca Gutierrez in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CT-323, 16CM-84 and 16CM-48.

9:48 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.
Atty Halverson appears on behalf of Atty Drengler today.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
15CT-323: Defendant will plead to Count 1. 
16CM-48: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 will be dismissed and read in
16CM-84: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Halverson concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CT-323: Count 1.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 16CM-48: Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

9:50 AM Court takes a short recess.
10:01 AM Court is back in session, same appearances as before.

State reiterates the plea agreement.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CT-323: Count 1: Found Guilty Operating w/o License 3rd or subsequent offense
16CM-48: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-48: Count 2: Found Guilty Operating w/o License 3rd or subsequent offense
16CM-84: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court believes the plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
15CT-323:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 10 Days
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
2 days credit
First half in custody, Second half may be served on electronic home monitoring if qualifies for program
May be transferred to Sauk County
Sheriff's Department may allow Defendant to serve the entire jail sentence on home monitor if approved and if financially better
Pay a fine of $300 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA Sample
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

16CM-48:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 10 Days, concurrent to 15CT-323
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days

First half in custody, Second half may be served on electronic home monitoring if qualifies for program

Sheriff's Department may allow Defendant to serve the entire jail sentence on home monitor if approved and if financially better
Pay a fine of $300 plus costs

60 days to pay or set up payment plan
